insulinDosingModules.name: Meal Insulin
insulinDosingModules.instructions: Learn how rapid-acting insulin affects glucose levels with different meals.

data.name: Rapid Insulin + Carb Meal
data.description: Proper rapid-acting insulin dose with carbohydrate meal maintains target glucose.

data.name: Rapid Insulin + Protein Meal
data.description: Insulin with protein-rich meals may cause more pronounced glucose lowering.

data.name: Carb Meal Without Insulin
data.description: Missing mealtime insulin leads to significant glucose elevation.

data.name: Under-dosed Meal Insulin
data.description: Inadequate insulin dosing results in post-meal hyperglycemia.

insulinDosingModules.name: Correction Doses
insulinDosingModules.instructions: Understand how correction insulin doses affect elevated glucose levels.

data.name: Mild High Correction
data.description: Correcting glucose from 160 mg/dL back to target range.

data.name: High Glucose Correction
data.description: Correcting severe hyperglycemia (250+ mg/dL) requires careful monitoring.

data.name: Insulin Stacking
data.description: Additional insulin given too soon can cause dangerous hypoglycemia.

data.name: Under-correction
data.description: Insufficient correction dose leaves glucose elevated above target.

insulinDosingModules.name: Insulin Profiles
insulinDosingModules.instructions: Compare how different insulin types affect glucose over time.

data.name: Rapid-Acting Insulin
data.description: Rapid-acting insulin works quickly with peak effect in 1-2 hours.

data.name: Long-Acting Insulin
data.description: Long-acting insulin provides steady, prolonged glucose control.

data.name: Insulin Pump Bolus
data.description: Pump boluses deliver precise rapid-acting insulin doses.

data.name: Split Correction Dose
data.description: Dividing large corrections can provide safer glucose lowering.

insulinDosingModules.name: Special Situations
insulinDosingModules.instructions: Learn how various situations can affect insulin effectiveness and glucose control.

data.name: Missed Meal After Insulin
data.description: Taking meal insulin without eating can cause severe hypoglycemia.

data.name: Exercise with Insulin
data.description: Exercise enhances insulin absorption and can cause rapid glucose drops.

data.name: Dawn Phenomenon
data.description: Morning hormone surges can cause glucose to rise despite insulin.

data.name: Illness/Stress Response
data.description: Illness and stress can increase insulin resistance and glucose levels.
